channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump aims to lower drug prices. And, Harvard's tax-exempt status threatened
item.description: Trump has signed an executive action aimed at lowering prescription drug prices. And, the president threatened to revoke Harvard University's tax-exem...

item.title: Study highlights cancer risk from millions of CT scans performed annually
item.description: They can be life-saving but radiation from the scans also contributes to cancer risk. The authors of a new study estimate overuse of CT scans is incre...

item.title: How psychiatric patients get caught in a cycle of homelessness and spotty care
item.description: Montana is investing $300 million to help those with severe mental illness from cycling through ERs, state psychiatric facilities, jails and homelessn...

item.title: Photos: Scientists trace a butterfly migration route that is millions of years old
item.description: Scientists have recently mapped the painted lady butterfly's annual flight from equatorial Africa to northern Europe and back, the world's longest but...

item.title: Families say school civil rights investigations have stalled after federal cuts
item.description: The U.S. Education Department's Office for Civil Rights investigates discrimination in schools. It recently lost more than 40% of its staff.

item.title: Racially charged row between Musk and South Africa over Starlink
item.description: The tech billionaire is embroiled in a row with the government over black empowerment legislation.

item.description: Lindsey Reiser reports on the latest in the case of a Maryland man mistakenly deported to El Salvador, how tariffs are leading to a target on a major ...

item.title: India's Gandhis charged in money laundering case amid opposition outcry
item.description: India's financial crimes agency has accused the Gandhis of illegally acquiring properties of a newspaper.

item.title: 4/15: America Decides
item.description: Judge holds hearing on mistakenly deported man after Salvadoran president said he won’t be returned; What’s next for Kamala Harris?

item.title: Doctor with "lust for murder" charged with killing 15 patients
item.description: Prosecutors said they charged a Berlin doctor with the murder of 15 patients, alleging he acted out of a "lust" for killing.

item.title: AP Was There: A truck bomb rips through a federal building in Oklahoma City in 1995

item.description: The former US president says his successor has "done so much damage and so much destruction" in his first days in office.

item.title: China appoints new trade envoy in face of tariff turmoil
item.description: The shift comes as Beijing refuses to back down in an escalating trade war with Washington.

item.title: US pastor kidnapped during church service in South Africa found after shoot-out
item.description: Three people died in the "high-intensity shootout" that led to Josh Sullivan's rescue, officials say.
